sentences.english: "Jemima Puddleduck" is a treatise on enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 《杰迈玛泥潭鸭》是一部关于企业的专著。

sentences.english: They would disappear in the marshland and the fog of war.
sentences.chinese: 他们将在战争的迷雾和泥潭中消逝无踪。

sentences.english: I sink in deep mire, where there is no foothold.
sentences.chinese: 我身陷泥潭中，找不到立足点。

sentences.english: For Shumlin, even a mud puddle can make for an adventure
sentences.chinese: 就算是一个小泥潭，也能被宣林演绎成历险的乐园。

sentences.english: We are stuck with the dollar standard for many years.
sentences.chinese: 多少年来我们一直陷入在美国本位的泥潭里。

sentences.english: All this should not imply that CUNY is out of the woods.
sentences.chinese: 这些变化并不意味这城市大学开始走出泥潭。

sentences.english: You may jump from the frying pan into the fire if you make a move today.
sentences.chinese: 如果今天擅自行动，结果是你跳出泥潭跳入火坑。

sentences.english: The US is bogged down in Iraq and Afghanistan.
sentences.chinese: 美国陷于伊拉克和阿富汗的泥潭。

sentences.english: Nineveh is like a puddle, and the water inside it is becoming less and less.
sentences.chinese: 尼尼微就像是一个泥潭，里面的水已经越来越少了。

sentences.english: The economy is trying to climb out of the mud.
sentences.chinese: 经济总是在拼命挣出泥潭。

sentences.english: Laura drew up a pailful of water from the well at the edge of the Big slough.
sentences.chinese: 罗拉在大泥潭边的水井里提上一桶水。

sentences.english: He probed the mud with a stick, looking for the ring he had dropped.
sentences.chinese: 他用一根棍儿在泥潭中搜寻他掉落的戒子。

sentences.english: As regards Japan, scores of her divisions will be inextricably bogged down in China.
sentences.chinese: 敌人方面，陷在中国泥潭中的几十个师团抽不出去。

sentences.english: Into this mire stepped the ambitious Senator Palpatine from Naboo.
sentences.chinese: 野心勃勃的帕尔帕廷议员从纳布步入这个泥潭。

sentences.english: Soon all the snow had melted and the German panzers and trucks were axle-deep in mud.
sentences.chinese: 很快冰雪消融，德军装甲部队和卡车陷入了泥潭。

sentences.english: The band Flowers is in trouble again, this time because of plagiary .
sentences.chinese: 花儿乐队因为剽窃再次陷入泥潭。

definition: to be deeply in (trouble, debt etc)/deep set (eyes)
to sink into/to get caught up in/to land in (a predicament)
to fall deeper and deeper (in debt, in love etc)
deep water and scorching fire/abyss of suffering (idiom)
pitfall/trap/to get stuck/to sink/to cave in/to frame (false charge)/to capture (a city in battle)/to fall (to the enemy)/defect
to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
